overview: From 2025-10-31 to 2025-11-01, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 7 new PRs (6 merged), 2 new issues, and 25 active contributors.

topIssues.title: tune flashblocks-websocket-proxy-upstream-messages-low alert sepolia
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
Currently, this alert's disabled. 

Experiment with removing op-conductor's hop in sepolia to notice any improvements in this alert.

topIssues.title: op-deployer: Add verification guides to OP docs
topIssues.author: janjakubnanista
topIssues.body:
**Description**

`op-deployer`'s verification has a limited block explorer & contract support. Instead of broadening the coverage in `op-deployer`, include the following verification scripts in the OP docs:

- [New chain](https://github.com/celo-org/optimism/blob/mc01/verify-new-testnet-deploy/packages/contracts-bedrock/scripts/deploy/verify-new-chain.sh)
- [Upgrade](https://github.com/celo-org/optimism/blob/mc01/celo-contracts/v3.0.0--1/packages/contracts-bedrock/scripts/deploy/verify-impls.sh)
- [Validator](https://github.com/celo-org/optimism/blob/mc01/celo-contracts/v3.0.0--1/packages/contracts-bedrock/scripts/deploy/verify-validator.sh)

These have been adjusted specifically for the Celo chain, but can easily be modified and included in the docs

topIssues.title: op-deployer: logs + etherscan verification on sepolia
topIssues.author: Ethnical
topIssues.body:
Hey 2 small issues that would be nice to improve:
1. It would be great to ensure that the logs are more explicit when there are already deployed contracts at the same address, such as:
```
git checkout op-contracts/v5.0.0-rc.1
cd op-deployer
just build-contracts
just copy-contract-artifacts
just build-go


PRIVATE_KEY=<redacted> NETWORK=sepolia ETH_RPC_URL=https://ethereum-sepolia-rpc.publicnode.com just deploy-opcm 'op-contracts/v5.0.0-rc.1'
```

topIssues.title: [op-acceptance-tests] Make acceptance-test workflow blocking
topIssues.author: scharissis
topIssues.body:
Prevent merges to `develop` which have failing acceptance tests.

They currently run, but do not prevent merges.

topIssues.title: devtools: Initial ideation and proposal
topIssues.author: janjakubnanista
topIssues.body:
**Description**

Explore the current strengths and weaknesses of our toolkit and define:

- The approach to standardization, in particular, standardization of a "chain descriptor" - a data structure that completely describes an OP stack chain
- Use netchef config as inspiration, try to align with it where / if possible
- The approach to toolkit architecture
- The rollout roadmap
- Ratify proposal with Platforms + representative Protocol and Rust team engineers + one rep from contracts development

topPRs.title: feat: cgt
topPRs.author: tynes
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Based on top of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17320

Enables OP Stack chains to use an asset other than ETH as their native fee currency by introducing a minimal, flexible, and standardizable Custom Gas Token (CGT) architecture. To do so, it introduces new **predeploys** (`NativeAssetLiquidity` and `LiquidityController`) that decouple native asset management from core bridging operations while using a single `isCustomGasToken()` flag that disables ETH transfer flows in all bridging methods. The two new pre-deploys manage the native asset supply.

**Tests**

Core contracts:

- `OptimismPortal` and `L1Block`: Tests for `isCustomGasToken()` flag blocking ETH deposits/withdrawals
- `NativeAssetLiquidity`: Tests deposit/withdraw access control and functionality
- `LiquidityController`: Tests minter authorization, mint/burn operations, and metadata functions

**Metadata**

- Spec: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/749
- Design Doc: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/305

---------------------------------

### Contributors
  - @0xOneTony
  - @0xniha
  - @agusduha
  - @ashitakah
  - @hexshire
  - @Joxess
  - @tynes

topPRs.title: op-deployer: Support working with V2 fault dispute game contracts
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Finish updating op-deployer to work with V2 fault dispute game contracts.

* Deploying implementations supports the fault dispute game configuration options previously used by deploy dispute game
* DeployDisputeGame has been updated to work with v1 and v2 contracts
* SetDisputeGameImpl works with and without game args
* ReadImplementationAddresses loads the V2 dispute game addresses

**Tests**

Existing tests continue working. Made a number of tests run with both v1 and v2 contracts.

topPRs.title: test(contracts): enhance L2ToL1MessagePasser test coverage and organization
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
# test(contracts): enhance L2ToL1MessagePasser test coverage and organization

## Summary

This PR improves the L2ToL1MessagePasser test file by:
- **Adding coverage** for previously untested functions: `version()`, `receive()`, and `messageNonce()` 
- **Adding edge case** test for `burn()` with zero balance (removed per review feedback)
- **Restoring tests with enhancements**: The `testFuzz_initiateWithdrawal_fromContract_succeeds` and `testFuzz_initiateWithdrawal_fromEOA_succeeds` tests have been restored with scenario-specific assertions (code length checks) to document the caller type being tested
- **Enhancing existing tests**: Added missing event expectation in burn test, added nonce increment assertion
- **Reorganizing** test contracts to match source function declaration order (Version → Receive → Burn → InitiateWithdrawal → MessageNonce)

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] **Verify messageNonce encoding test correctness** - The new test checks that `nonce >> 240 == 1` to verify MESSAGE_VERSION is encoded in upper 2 bytes. Please verify this matches the actual `Encoding.encodeVersionedNonce()` implementation.
- [ ] **Run tests locally** - Execute `just test-dev --match-path test/L2/L2ToL1MessagePasser.t.sol` to confirm all tests pass (they passed in my environment).

### Notes

- **CI interface check failures**: The pre-pr validation shows interface check failures, but I verified these are pre-existing on the base branch (`d242f9f9be`) and unrelated to these test changes. My changes only touch the test file.
- The `receive()` test uses `address(this)` as both sender and target for simplicity, which is fine for testing the receive function behavior.
- All new tests follow the repository's conventions: proper naming, SemverComp for version validation, fuzz testing where appropriate.
- The restored `fromContract` and `fromEOA` tests now include explicit assertions about the caller's code length to document the scenario being tested.
- The `test_burn_zeroBalance_succeeds` test was removed per review feedback as the zero-balance case is already covered by `testFuzz_burn_succeeds` when `_value == 0`.

**Link to Devin run:** https://app.devin.ai/sessions/3c98e34e07874e7d9c1f85e095d3af0b  
**Requested by:** Ariel Diaz (@aliersh, ariel@oplabs.co)

Last update: 2025-10-27 11:19 ET

completedItems.title: op-acceptance-tests: Improve DA footprint test stability
completedItems.body:
**Description**

Improves DA footprint acceptance tests, making them more stable when running on real networks.
- Skipping first initial scalar tests if a non-zero scalar is already set
